alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 9:45AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Near Lake Arthur affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This surpasses the flood of record. * WHERE...Pecos River near Lake Arthur. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 26.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Pecos River Lake Arthu 20.0 10.1 Wed 9 am MDT 24.2 12.3 9.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 945 PM MDT.
